description: Recovery of October 2005 earthquake affected population through addressing environmental issues like landslides and restoring livelihoods through natural resource management.

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacity to respond to gender-based violence and to increase women’s civic engagement, participation and leadership in crisis prevention, ongoing crisis and post-crisis contexts
subproject.description: This Program is designed to address the environmental issues mainly landslides which have become serious threat to the life and livelihoods of the communities living in the area seriously hit by the 2005 South-Asian Earthquake. The programme with the participation of the local communities is working to increase the vegetation cover and livelihoods enhancement through natural resource management. The Program’s development has been guided by the needs identified in the joint UNEP/OCHA South Asia Earthquake Disaster Preliminary Environmental Assessment completed in early December 2005.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: CPR-Environmental Recovery Pro
